data.description: These cookies are chewy, sweet and delicious. Perfect for serving at any happy occasion.
data.ingredients:
1 cup softened butter
1 cup white sugar
1 cup light brown sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
2 large eggs
3 cups flour
1 tsp baking soda
0.5 tsp baking powder
1 tsp salt
2 cups chocolate chips

photos.description: Preheat oven to 375F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, salt and baking powder. Set aside.
Cream together butter and sugars until combined. Beat in the eggs and vanilla.
Mix the dry ingredients in until combined Mix in the chocolate.
Roll into balls of dough and space evenly on the cookie sheets.
Bake for about 10 minutes or until they are just starting to brown.
Let them sit on the baking pan for 2 minutes before removing to cooling rack.

data.description: This delicious dinner is a surefire winner in my house. Filled with hearty, homemade goodness.
data.ingredients:
1 package lasagna noodles
3/4 pound ground beef
1 medium onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 cans crushed tomatoes
2 cans tomato paste
2/3 cup water
2 to 3 tablespoons sugar
1/4 cup minced fresh parsley
2 teaspoons dried basil
3/4 teaspoon salt
1 egg, beaten

photos.description: Cook noodles according to directions on package and drain.
Cook the onion and beef over medium heat until meat browns.
Add garlic, stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, water, sugar, parsley, salt and pepper; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a small bowl, mix egg and cheese. Preheat oven to 375Â°F and spread 2 cups of meat sauce into a baking dish.
Layer with 3 noodles and 1/3 of the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses. Repeat layers twice. Top with remaining meat sauce and cheeses.
Bake covered for 25 minutes, or until bubbly. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

data.description: Fresh, light, impressive and nutritious. Perfectly served with white wine.
data.ingredients:
12 oz sushi-grade salmon
6 oz rice
1 tablespoon sesame seeds
1/2 avocado
2 stalks green onion
2 shallots
4 cloves garlic
2 tablespoons soy sauce
2 teaspoons sesame oil
2 tablespoons green onion rings

photos.description: Cook the rice and let it cool. Remove skin from the salmon and then slice into 3/4-inch cubes.
In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, sesame oil and green onion.
Add the fish cubes to the bowl and fold until thoroughly mixed.
Tightly cover the bowl with the marinated fish and marinate in the refrigerator for 1/2 hour.
Toast sesame seeds in a frying pan over medium heat. Slice the shallots into fine rings and sautee them until golden.
Cut the avocado into cubes.
Assemble the poke bowls by adding rice, fish, avocado and the rest of the toppings.

data.description: We serve this creamy and delicious soup at our annual Thanksgiving dinner.
data.ingredients:
6 cups chicken stock
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
4 cups pumpkin puree
1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley
1 cup chopped onion
1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme
1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 cup heavy whipping cream
5 whole black peppercorns

photos.description: Heat the stock, salt, pumpkin, onion, thyme, garlic, and peppercorns. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 30 minutes uncovered.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 30 minutes uncovered. Cool and then puree in small batches with a food processor or blender.
Return the pureed soup to the pan and bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low, and simmer for another 30 minutes, uncovered.
Stir in heavy cream. Pour into soup bowls and garnish with fresh parsley.
Roll into balls of dough and space evenly on the cookie sheets.
